instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message:
Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> from <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015

This board has no video, but it chime!!

Just now at this moment I have another 100% working <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 MBP with same board 4924, so I took lcd assembly and lcd cable and tested and it is not screen problem. It is board problem.

L8300 - stable 5V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_EDP_SW</SIGNAL> - 3.3V

Is there anything more I can check? This MBP comes to me with cracked screen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: If there is 5V on L8300 there is an image, hold flashlight to Apple logo.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: Allready did that. I did it now again with hdd and without. Wait 3 minutes and nothing. No viode, no backlight. No video at all. I have seen many backlight problems and I know what you mean but this MBP has no video!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>? LCD must do something if there is 5V on L8300......

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> - 3.3V

Any idea what more to check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: Yes, check better if there is 5V on L8300 something must happen on the LCD.....Check external video?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message:
Boot into an OS using HDMI out with internal display unplugged to rule out destroyed PCH/CPU. Once that is confirmed, check <CAPACITOR>C8320</CAPACITOR>-<CAPACITOR>C8328</CAPACITOR>, people knocking that off with their fingernail is common. Also confirm FL8300-FL8303 are present.

On the 3536 and 3476 this issue could be confirmed by booting into 3S162 ASD EFI and you would get a displayport symbol error. but on 4924, no ASD. :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message:
No Title

I just got the same issue for the same board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A.  The board barely had water damage on the corner where LCD connector was located from water bottle in back pack.  I cleaned the area up with flux and reflowed the bad looking solder joints.  Connector J8300 pin 36,37,38,39,40,41 - Connector J4915 pin 4,  <CHIP>U8300</CHIP>  and on the reverse side of board the only thing I saw that had corrosion was <CAPACITOR>C7778</CAPACITOR>, check for short here and none.. I cleaned it all up and reflow with new solder.   It boots up and chimes and also with the external screen via with HDMI output I got image and can use the laptop.  The LCD male connector on the display looks clean and solid.  I took measurements at the board connector and only have 5.1v at pin 3 and 5.1v on pin 4 and  all other pin is 0v.  I check <CAPACITOR>C8320</CAPACITOR>- <CAPACITOR>C8328</CAPACITOR> all is present ... I don't have extra display to test.  Am I on the right track.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: Start a new thread but you really need to replace the connector and get a working test screen first before going any further.
